New Release

Remember the good times before they fade.

Say it now, share forever. Ever last lets you record heartfelt video, voice, or written messages and securely deliver them to loved ones, on a future date, a special occasion, or even after your passing.

Far Too Long Have We left it late..

We all think we have more time. But life is fragile. Everlast gives you the peace of mind to express love, gratitude, or guidance — and ensure it’s received at the right moment.

SAY IT BEFORE IT'S TOO LATE

FOR MILESTONES

Send a message for a child’s 18th birthday, a wedding day, or a graduation to show you've always thought about them.

RELATIONAL MOMENTS

Apology or Forgiveness “I’m sorry” A message sent posthumously or on a future date to heal a rift. Identity Journey

SUDDEN EVENTS

A person or couple wants to leave words of comfort, closure, or guidance for loved ones incase of a sudden event.

LEGACY & MEMORY PRESERVATION

Family History. Stories from Grandparents or parents recording oral histories, recipes, or cultural traditions.

HOW EVERLAST WORKS

RECORD YOUR MESSAGE

Speak, write, or record a video — in your voice, your words, your heart.

CHOOSE WHEN IT'S DELIVERED

On a birthday, anniversary, or set to deliver after your passing.

THEY RECEIVE IT WITH LOVE

Your loved one gets your message securely — a gift that lasts forever.

Create the message that matters

Written Letters

Your privacy. Our promise.

We take the sacred trust of your message seriously. Everlast is built with military-grade encryption and zero-access privacy.

Record Your Message Now

Frequently Asked Questions

Can I change or delete my message later?

Yes. You can edit or delete your message at any time before it’s delivered.

What happens if I forget to renew?

We’ll notify you well in advance. Your messages are never deleted without your consent.

How do my loved ones receive the message?

They’ll get a secure email with a link to view your message. No app needed.

Is this only for end-of-life messages?

No. Use it for birthdays, anniversaries, apologies, or anything heartfelt.
